Articles.Content:
The first Cinematic I've made in KSP with a plotline... it's shot without any visual aids, just stock KSP. It is a test of a friend's battleship, which took quite a few hits to destroy. It's all 100% real combat; at certain points in the video you can see the UI, because it was difficult aiming and at the same time filming. But I think it turned out really well. I also tried to imitate Kerba speak, by taking random audio clips and playing them backwards. Tell me what you think!

Edited November 8, 2014 by zekes

That ship...

Bloody hell, that thing's gorgeous!

It's actually my friend's battleship, it's got good armor but less than 1K D/V, and missiles that don't do anything. And it's 1400 parts.
That's why the Mk-IV Victory class is focused on practicality rather than the look of the ship.

I like it a lot Zekes, it's a beautiful concept, which I may or may not be planning to put my own spin on if I can build what I'm thinking of now.

From a technical standpoint, (and this comes from a place of love and my own experience.)

It's a little dark: Not your fault, orbital stuff in KSP is pretty dark, and FRAPS makes it darker. (Ambient light plugin has helped me in my videos.)

The UI can be turned off with F2: I know you were using it to pilot things, I guess you cropped out the navball? I know it's annoying (but if you're filming stuff in KSP you know all about annoying) what I tend to do is pilot things "on target", then F5 then hit F2 to hide the UI, and let things run while I film. If it doesn't work reload and try again. Though I guess MechJeb might help more?

KerbCAM makes those panning shots smoother, and with large craft, I can get a high "apparent" frame rate by doing a very slow pan and speeding up the footage. I know how framey KSP can get with FRAPS running and a 1400 part ship.

I don't use video editing stuff for titles, I use GIMP,

Something like this took just a few minutes but looks good IMO, just plop it into your video editor and do a little zoom.

Edited November 12, 2014 by glen.mack

I like it a lot Zekes, it's a beautiful concept, which I may or may not be planning to put my own spin on if I can build what I'm thinking of now.

From a technical standpoint, (and this comes from a place of love and my own experience.)

It's a little dark: Not your fault, orbital stuff in KSP is pretty dark, and FRAPS makes it darker. (Ambient light plugin has helped me in my videos.)

The UI can be turned off with F2: I know you were using it to pilot things, I guess you cropped out the navball? I know it's annoying (but if you're filming stuff in KSP you know all about annoying) what I tend to do is pilot things "on target", then F5 then hit F2 to hide the UI, and let things run while I film. If it doesn't work reload and try again. Though I guess MechJeb might help more?

KerbCAM makes those panning shots smoother, and with large craft, I can get a high "apparent" frame rate by doing a very slow pan and speeding up the footage. I know how framey KSP can get with FRAPS running and a 1400 part ship.

I don't use video editing stuff for titles, I use GIMP,

http://i.imgur.com/XWi6rHP.png

Something like this took just a few minutes but looks good IMO, just plop it into your video editor and do a little zoom.

1) Yeah, i know it's dark, I can probably lighten it a bit.... or just film on the light side

2) I turn the UI off for 90% of the shots, i think it may have gotten in there once, but for the most part it is off... but when i do just that

3) For some reason Kerbcam never really works for me, mabye I'm using it wrong, but it just seems to stay in place, and not follow the ship, nor is it easy to preplan shots: i tend to shoot on a whim, and that's hard to do in kerbcam.

4) I now have the Time Control mod, so i can slow down the shots. I'll use this to increase FPS on shots.

5) As for the titles, that would be helpful, but I'm not too good with the Title maker in Permiere Pro (that I use) so i go to Windows Movie Maker (i just think it's faster/easier to add the titles there )

I also have a new video, for the series I'm making. I think it's much improved but the FPS can be improved a bit more as well...
